reasoning: Place the program entry first to improve immediate comprehension. After main, put initialization/setup (init_array, ID 0) so readers see how data is prepared. Group the three kernel helper routines (kernel_mean ID 4, kernel_reduce ID 5, kernel_cov ID 6) next — these are the core computation helpers and should be adjacent for logical flow. Finally put print_array (ID 2) last as a display/utility function. This ordering improves readability, groups related utilities, and ensures functions that are called by others appear before their callers to aid debugging and comprehension.
